contentrichtext.text: <!-- please do not add an infobox, per [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Composers#Biographical infoboxes]]--> '''Zoltán Kocsis''' ({{IPA-hu|ˈzoltaːn ˈkotʃiʃ|lang}}; born May 30, 1952) is a [[Hungary|Hungarian]] [[pianist]], [[conducting|conductor]], and [[composer]]. Born in [[Budapest]], he started his musical studies at the age of five and continued them at the [[Béla Bartók]] Conservatory in 1963, studying [[piano]] and [[musical composition|composition]]. In 1968 he was admitted to the [[Franz Liszt Academy of Music]], where he was a pupil of [[Pál Kadosa]] and Ferenc Rados.<ref>[[Hungaroton]] LP SLPX11711 Liner Notes.</ref> In 1970, he gave his first important debuts both at home and abroad. During the following 25 years he toured all over the world, performing with the [[Berliner Philharmoniker]], [[Chicago Symphony Orchestra]], the [[Dresden Staatskapelle]], the [[San Francisco Symphony Orchestra]], the [[New York Philharmonic]], the [[Philharmonia]] of London, and the [[Wiener Philharmoniker]]. American critic [[Harold Schonberg]] praised Kocsis' extraordinary technique and fine piano tone.<ref>Harold C. Schonberg, The Great Pianists from Mozart to the Present, Second Edition, Simon & Schuster, 1987</ref> Kocsis has recorded the complete solo and with orchestra piano work of [[Béla Bartók]].<ref>Zoltán Kocsis plays Bartók, Philips 8 CD set 475 6720.</ref> In 1990, his recording of [[Debussy]]'s "[[Images pour orchestre|Images]]"<ref>Now issued as Philips CD 475 210-2.</ref> won "The Gramophone" Instrumental Award for that year. In recent years, Kocsis has taken the role of conductor, especially with the [[Budapest Festival Orchestra]] (of which he was a founder)<ref>See Budapest Festival Orchestra website (links).</ref> and the [[Hungarian National Philharmonic]], where he is the current musical director.<ref>See Hungarian National Philharmonic website (links).</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.bach-cantatas.com/Bio/Kocsis-Zoltan.htm Zoltán Kocsis biography] *[http://www.classicstoday.com/digest/pdigest.asp?perfidx=24083 Listing and reviews of Kocsis recordings] *[http://www.darvas.de/kocsise.htm TV and Video Productions with Zoltán Kocsis] *[http://www.filharmonikusok.hu/ Hungarian National Philharmonic Orchestra website] *[http://www.bfz.hu/ Budapest Festival Orchestra website] *[http://www.opus3artists.com/artists/zolt%C3%A1n-kocsis Opus 3 Artists, Profile] *[http://www.cosmopolis.ch/english/cosmo5/kocsis.htm Zoltán Kocsis biography and concert review in cosmopolis.ch] {{S-start}} {{s-culture}} {{Succession box| title=[[Hungarian National Philharmonic|Principal Conductors, Hungarian National Philharmonic Orchestra]] | before=[[Ken-Ichiro Kobayashi]] | years= 1997-''present'' | after=incumbent}} {{S-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=85658415}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Kocsis, Zoltán | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Hungarian conductor, pianist and composer | DATE OF BIRTH =May 30, 1952 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kocsis, Zoltan}} [[Category:1952 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Hungarian classical pianists]] [[Category:Hungarian conductors (music)]] [[Category:Hungarian composers]] [[Category:Franz Liszt Academy of Music alumni]] {{Hungary-classical-musician-stub}} {{classical-pianist-stub}}
